definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: The present is so bizarre and my state of mind so confused.
sentences.chinese: 目前是这么离奇，心里是这么芜杂。

sentences.english: He rushed about doing preposterous things in an extraordinary manner.
sentences.chinese: 他奔来奔去，离奇古怪地干下了种种荒谬的事情。

sentences.english: A quirky film about unrequited love.
sentences.chinese: 一部关于单恋的离奇影片。

sentences.english: The nightmare is really effective, some people die a violent death mystically, some people are murdered strangely.
sentences.chinese: 噩梦果真灵验，有人神秘暴毙，有人离奇遇害。

sentences.english: I like films with plenty of action.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢情节曲折离奇的动作片。

sentences.english: He looks at me suddenly. “Does this seem weird to you?” he says.
sentences.chinese: 他突然看着我说，“这对你看来似乎很离奇吧？”

sentences.english: 'So you've stopped having funny dreams?' said Hermione sceptically .
sentences.chinese: 那你不做那些离奇古怪的梦了？“赫敏怀疑地说。

sentences.english: Strange rumors were then being bandied about.
sentences.chinese: 那时正流传著种种离奇的谣言。

sentences.english: He said some really off –the-wall things.
sentences.chinese: 他说了一些非常离奇的事。

sentences.english: He talks of the most impossible things in the gravest possible manner.
sentences.chinese: 他会带着最严肃的表情告诉我一些最离奇的事情。

sentences.english: The most grotesque fantastic conceits haunted him in his bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚躺在床上的时候，各种离奇怪诞的幻想纷至沓来。

sentences.english: That's why I do not have food with hot sauce or chili.
sentences.chinese: 英国男子吃自制咖喱酱后离奇死亡疑被辣椒辣死。

sentences.english: The history of the nuptial pastry, though, is even stranger than these modern rituals suggests.
sentences.chinese: 然而婚庆糕点史比这些现代仪典表现的还要离奇。

sentences.english: Some cases are ridiculously wrong, and some cases totally reversed the right and the wrong.
sentences.chinese: 有些案子错得离奇，有些案子则完全颠倒黑白。

sentences.english: "This is a weird one. Strange, " Richfield police Lt.
The struggle between these two men was a rather weird affair.
sentences.chinese: 这两个人之间的斗争相当离奇古怪。

definition: lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
